thread.title: Wealdstone murder: Man brutally stabbed to death at rush hour in front of shocked commuters - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Wealdstone murder: Man brutally stabbed to death at rush hour in front of shocked commuters - Mirror Online

author: Scarlet Howes
title: Wealdstone murder: Man brutally stabbed to death at rush hour in front of shocked commuters - Mirror Online
text:
Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Cops have launched a murder investigation after a man was brutally stabbed to death by a busy railway station during last night's rush hour. 
The 34-year-old was found close to Harrow and Wealdstone station just before 7pm Monday. 
A witness said the victim was stabbed in the chest outside a branch of Halifax as commuters made their way home down the busy high street, the Evening Standard reports. 
The man was rushed to a hospital in central London in a critical condition but died in the early hours of the morning. 
Scotland Yard said he was pronounced dead at about 2.30am and his next of kin have been informed. 
Forensics teams were trawling the scene of the attack throughout the night, witnesses said. 
Scotland yard said: "A murder investigation has been launched following the death of a man in Wealdstone and detectives are appealing for witnesses and information. 
"On Monday, 27 February police were called at approximately 6.50pm to reports of a man stabbed in High Street, Wealdstone - near the junctions with George Gange Way and Gordon Road. 
"Officers and London Ambulance Service attended the scene and the man - believed aged 34 - was taken to a central London hospital in critical condition. 
"He was later pronounced dead at around 2.30am on Tuesday. 
"Next of kin have been informed. 
"Detectives from the Homicide and Major Crime Command are investigating. 
"Whilst officers believe they know who the deceased is, they await formal identification. 
"A post mortem examination will be scheduled in due course. 
"There have been no arrests at this stage and enquiries continue." 
Murder Squad's Detective Chief Inspector Mark Lawson said: "We believe the area at the time of the stabbing, just before 6.50pm in the evening, would have been very busy with people coming from nearby Harrow and Wealdstone station. 
"We are very keen to hear from anyone who was in and around the Wealdstone High Street area that may have seen or heard anything suspicious, especially from anyone who saw people running towards the station." Like us on Facebook
